title: Honoring Patricia D. Claiborne upon the occasion of her retirement after many years of distinguished service
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Patricia D. Claiborne upon the occasion
of her retirement after many years of distinguished service  to  Cornell
University Cooperative Extension, Orange County, New York

WHEREAS,  It  is  the  sense of this Legislative Body to acknowledge the
significant milestones in the distinguished careers  of  esteemed  resi-
dents of this noble Empire State; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor
Patricia D. Claiborne upon the occasion of her retirement after 38 years
of  distinguished  service  to Cornell University Cooperative Extension,
Orange County, New York, to be celebrated at  a  retirement  dinner  and
tribute  on  February  11, 2011, at Kuhl's Highland House in Middletown,
New York; and
  WHEREAS, For the past 38 years, Patricia Claiborne rendered  faithful,
conscientious  and  valuable  service  to Cornell University Cooperative
Extension,  earning  the  admiration,  esteem  and  affection   of   her
colleagues; and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  her  career,  Patricia  Claiborne  has  embodied
Cornell University Cooperative Extension's mission of enabling people to
improve their lives and communities through partnerships that put  expe-
rience and research knowledge to work; and
  WHEREAS,  A  graduate  of  Virginia  State College, Patricia Claiborne
earned her Master's degree from Cornell University joining  the  Cornell
Cooperative Extension in July of 1972; since the beginning of her career
Patricia  Claiborne  managed all aspects of operations providing leader-
ship and opportunities for the youth and families of Orange County; and
  WHEREAS, Patricia Claiborne started as a Cooperative  Extension  Agent
responsible for providing leadership for the Expanded Food and Nutrition
Education  Program;  in  1978  she  became  an  Extension Associate with
Cornell Cooperative Extension Administration in Ithaca, New York,  where
she learned about the Extension System and was a Program Liaison between
county  associations  and  extension  administration  providing  program
support to field staff; and
  WHEREAS, In 1982 Patricia Claiborne returned to Cooperative  Extension
in Orange County as Home Economics Program Leader, and in 2004 ultimate-
ly became the Executive Director; and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  her  prestigious  career, Patricia Claiborne has
been the recipient of many awards  and  accolades  including  the  Human
Rights  Commission  Award,  the  National  Association of Extension Home
Economists Newsletter Award, the National Association of Extension  Home
Economists  Diversity  Award,  and the Leadership Orange Pinnacle Award;
and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Patricia Claiborne is also the  proud  recipient
of  the  National Association of Family and Consumer Science's Financial
Management Award; she was selected as a Woman of Achievement  of  Orange
County  in  2004  by  the Sarah Wells Girl Scout Council and the YWCA of
Orange County where she served as their Honorary Chairwoman for the 2008
Tribute to Women of Achievement of Orange County; and
  WHEREAS, Patricia Claiborne also contributes of her  time  and  energy
through  her many community affiliations and board memberships including
the Orange Regional Medical Center Board of Directors, Emergency Housing
Board of Directors, Orange County Citizens Foundation Board of Directors
and Board of Directors Middletown Kiwanis Club; she has also served,  in
the past, on numerous other boards and committees; and
  WHEREAS,  In  her  capacity  as Executive Director, Patricia Claiborne
served with loyalty, honor and distinction, and was governed by  a  keen

sense  of duty and always showed a unique grasp of human problems in her
official acts; and
  WHEREAS,  Patricia Claiborne resides in Middletown, New York, with her
son Justin;  in  her  spare  time  she  enjoys  reading  and  collecting
antiques; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when individ-
uals of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought  to  our  atten-
tion,  they  should  be celebrated and recognized by all the citizens of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor Patricia D. Claiborne upon the occasion of her retirement after 38
years  of distinguished service to Cornell University Cooperative Exten-
sion, Orange County, New York; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Patricia D. Claiborne.
